org.finra.herd.core.config

Class CoreSpringModuleConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.finra.herd.core.config.CoreSpringModuleConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer

    @Configuration
 @ComponentScan(value="org.finra.herd.core",
               excludeFilters=)
 @PropertySource(value="classpath:herdBuildInfo.properties")
 @EnableAsync
 @EnableAspectJAutoProxy(proxyTargetClass=true)
public class CoreSpringModuleConfig
extends Object
implements org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer
    Core Spring module configuration.

      • buildInformation

        @Bean
public BuildInformation buildInformation()
        Gets the build information.
        Returns:

      • getAsyncExecutor

        @Bean
public org.springframework.core.task.TaskExecutor getAsyncExecutor()
        Returns an Async "task" executor which is also a normal "executor".It is also being used by the "@EnableAsync" annotation and the fact that this class implements AsyncConfigurer. That way, all methods annotated with "@Async" will be executed asynchronously by this executor.
        Specified by:
        getAsyncExecutor in interface org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer
        Returns:
        the async task executor.

        public org.springframework.aop.interceptor.AsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler getAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler()
